importTab.introText: If you already track your finances using a spreadsheet or any tool that can export to CSV, you can import it in finance_stuff. We will create the necessary accounts and entries together with all the values you have been tracking in past.
importTab.exportInstructions: Export your data as CSV and upload it here. For example in Google sheets: > File > Download > Comma-separated values (CSV)
importTab.dragDropInstruction: Drag & drop a CSV file here, or click to select one
importTab.emptyProposalMessage: No proposal was generated, that might mean there is nothing to import from your spreadsheet because you already have all data. Otherwise try with another CSV.
importTab.reviewInstructions: Review the proposal and click Import if all looks good otherwise prompt which changes you would like to make to try again
importTab.changeProposalInstructions: If you need to make changes to the proposal, explain what is wrong and what changes you would like so that our AI can attempt a new proposal.

description.part1: Unlike Bank accounts, Investments accounts are accounts
description.part2: where you expect value to fluctuate
description.part3: even if you won't add or remove money.
description.part4: For example: stocks, crypto, bonds. You initially invest an amount, might add/remove each month but their value also fluctuates.

investmentsAccountsTab.connectInstructions: After creating an account you can connect it to external accounts (e.g. banks, crypto exchanges, stock brokers, etc...) to autofill the amounts each time you create an entry and see live data.

dateHeader.title: Date
dateHeader.tip: The date of the accounting entry, we suggest to do it monthly, for example at the end of each month, but you can do it weekly or as you like. When you are ready to add a new entry, click the Add entry button and choose the date.

profitsHeader.title: Profits
profitsHeader.tip: Profits or losses of investments based on the amount invested

percentageHeader.tip: The percentage of your investments profits against the amount invested

differenceHeader.title: Difference
differenceHeader.tip: The difference compared to the previous entry

quotes.default:
Master your money with simple tracking.
Manage spending, savings, and investments effortlessly!
Start building better financial habits today.
quotes.expenses:
Track your expenses automatically using bank statements.
Tracking expense is time consuming, let us do it for you.
quotes.savings:
Track your savings and achieve your goals.
Manage your spending, savings, and investments effortlessly!
Start improving your savings today.
quotes.budgeting:
We help you budget and track your savings.
Manage your budgets, spending, and investments effortlessly!
quotes.spreadsheet:
Spreadsheets are great and very powerful. But they can get very complex.
After years of over-engineering a personal finance spreadsheet we decided to turn it into an app, to make it simpler and more powerful.
It's tailored to tracking personal finances and easier to use.

security.question: Is my data secure?
security.answer: Your financial data is very sensitive, first of all we offer an anonymous sign up option if you prefer to use it. Other than that the most sensitive data is encrypted in the database.

why.question: Why should I track my personal finances?
why.answer: Tracking your personal finances is crucial for achieving financial stability and growth. It helps you understand your spending habits, identify areas for improvement, set realistic financial goals, and make informed decisions about your money. By consistently monitoring your finances, you can build better saving habits, reduce debt, plan for the future, and ultimately gain peace of mind about your financial situation.

spreadsheet.question: I already use a spreadsheet, why should I switch over?
spreadsheet.answer:
While spreadsheets are versatile but can get very complex and not user friendly when you want to get more data and insights out of them. finance_stuff offers several advantages:
1) Automated data import and updates save time and reduce errors. Even simply adding a new bank account or investement in a spreadsheet is time consuming.
2) Our AI-powered assistant gives you contextual information and can help you make decisions.
3) User-friendly interface makes tracking and visualizing your finances easier.
4) Advanced features like statistics and future projections are built-in.
5) Secure cloud storage ensures your data is safe and accessible across devices.
6) Regular updates add new features without you having to redesign your spreadsheet.

import.question: Can I import data from other apps?
import.answer: Absolutely! We offer an importer from CSV files, most apps should allow you to export your data in CSV, for example google sheets or notion databases.

automation.question: Can I automate my personal finance tracking?
automation.answer: We offer connections to some popular services to automatically get your balances, for example binance or blockchains connectors are already available. Many more to come! Feel free to hit us up to request a connector.

aboutMe.title: About Me
aboutMe.content: I'm Alex Manzella, the creator of finance_stuff. I'm a Software Engineer with 13 years of experience, in the recent years I have been a Principal Engineer at {{n26Link}} a popular mobile bank in Europe and a Tech Lead at {{amieLink}} an amazing productivity app. I'm very interested in finance and worked for many years in fintech. I am interested in blockchains and DeFi. After years of over-engineering my personal finance spreadsheet I decided to turn it into an app, to make it simpler and more powerful.
